sub_topic: The self-similarity of the Lévy C curve.
message_1: Suppose we have a Lévy C curve of length 100 units. If we create a copy of this curve that is 1/3 the length and scale it to fit within the original curve, how long is the resulting curve?
message_2:
If we create a copy of the Lévy C curve that is 1/3 the length of the original curve, the length of the copied curve will be:

(1/3) * 100 = 100/3 ≈ 33.33 units

Now, if we scale this copied curve to fit within the original curve, the length of the resulting curve will still be 33.33 units, as the scaling process does not change the length of the curve.
